A few interesting stats around veterans:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gulf War-era veterans make up the largest share of US veterans, having passed Vietnam-era veterans in 2016.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The share of veterans is rapidly declining, dropping to 7% in 2018 from 18% in 1980.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But, the share of veterans who are women is expected to increase, from 11% currently to 18% in 2046.</span></li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On a logistical note, most banks are closed today but the stock market is open.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/prices-rise-at-their-fastest-pace-in-more-than-30-years-putting-more-pressure-on-the-fed?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Inflation Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/prices-rise-at-their-fastest-pace-in-more-than-30-years-putting-more-pressure-on-the-fed?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Vin Diesel saying "I like it here" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=288 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-10/image-75744d9c79329f6384f8113779a941e4c8883611-480x206-gif/giphy(11).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Vin Diesel saying "I like it here" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-10/image-75744d9c79329f6384f8113779a941e4c8883611-480x206-gif/giphy(11).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Inflation said it just needed a place to crash while it got back on its feet, but now it's officially moved in.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consumer prices rocketed higher than expected last month, jumping 6.2% annually for their biggest increase in 31 years, the Labor Department reported yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everything from your gas bill to your breakfast is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/10/consumer-price-index-october.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting more expensive</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fuel oil prices climbed 12.3% last month and are now up 59.1% compared to last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meat, poultry, fish, and eggs increased 1.7% last month and have climbed 11.9% for the year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is good news for anyone planning a Miami vacation: Prices for alcohol and airline tickets fell.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How did we get here? </strong>To make a long story short, the economic reopening from the pandemic caused all sorts of disruptions, from labor shortages to supply chain bottlenecks, which have contributed to rising prices.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is now becoming a political issue</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With inflation coming in above 5% for five straight months now, many Americans are getting a little freaked out, and they are looking to policymakers for answers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Officials are also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-inflation-cpi-rates-11636552015?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">frustrated</a>—inflation was supposed to be a summer fling, not a serious relationship. “I had expected to see more progress by now,” Chicago Fed President Charles Evans acknowledged this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fed now believes that inflation will run hot well into next year, which has bolstered its plan to hike rates and cool down the economy. It’s already planning to reduce its monthly bond purchases that propped up markets during the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-09/yellen-says-fed-wouldn-t-allow-repeat-of-1970s-level-inflation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stressed</a> on Tuesday that officials won’t let inflation get as out of control as it did during periods of the ’70s and ’80s. “That isn’t happening now and the Federal Reserve wouldn’t permit that to happen,” she said. But it’s being put to the test.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/3-buffalo-area-starbucks-locations-begin-union-votes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Starbucks Union Effort Gains Steam
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/3-buffalo-area-starbucks-locations-begin-union-votes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Starbucks coffee cup with steam coming out of it" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/35a4dd99077a64c5fbeb948fe89eb14d37f89fc0-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Approximately 100 baristas at three Starbucks locations around Buffalo, NY, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-lifestyle-business-national-labor-relations-board-health-6f9a1f9a53fc874ebdb6438df1f4223f?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">began voting</a> yesterday on whether to unionize.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’d be historic. </strong>The coffee chain has dodged previous unionization efforts by offering pay increases and venti-sized benefit packages. But Buffalo-area employees say they deserve a bigger piece of the chain’s record-breaking revenue ($29 billion last fiscal year), especially after the pandemic put a spotlight on the safety risks of their jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starbucks <em>really </em>doesn’t want a second Bills Mafia. The company has urged employees to vote “no” on unionization and has sent what seems like <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/starbucks-executive-swept-floors-in-unionizing-buffalo-new-york-store-2021-9?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every top exec </a>on an upstate New York vacay.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It even pulled some out of retirement. Howard Schultz, the former CEO, flew to Buffalo on Saturday to give a 45-minute speech about Sbux’s incredible company culture.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Whether or not your PSL is part of labor activism history, the outcome of this union vote could reverberate across the rest of the restaurant industry, where recently empowered workers are fed up with mistreatment.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/alibaba-s-singles-day-is-less-hyped-than-past-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
On 11/11, Make a Wish and Instantly Gratify It
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before Amazon Prime Day, there was Alibaba’s Singles Day—a mega Chinese shopping event that starts on Nov. 1 and culminates with a grand finale today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last year, Singles Day generated nearly <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/11/01/what-we-know-about-11-11-china-s-sales-bonanza-so-far?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three times</a> as much in sales for Alibaba as Cyber Monday, Thanksgiving, and Black Friday <em>combined</em> did across the US. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But China’s biggest shopping holiday has been decidedly less hyped this year. The Chinese government has been <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/chinas-singles-day-shopping-fest-060050281.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bearing down</a> on tech giants and pushing companies toward achieving “common prosperity,” which Alibaba added to its “core corporate responsibilities” list in September.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Earlier in the year, Alibaba was fined a record $2.8 billion for antitrust violations, and cofounder Jack Ma has largely stayed out of the public eye for about a year (</span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z5VMX1CznCg" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not his style</a></span><span>).</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since the government’s new groove doesn’t jibe with Alibaba raking in billions on luxury goods, this year the company’s been playing down Singles Day marketing and instead playing up its sustainable growth initiatives and support for small businesses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>analysts expect this Singles Day to top last year’s sales, possibly because a record number of merchants are participating. But it’ll only set a record by a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/chinas-alibaba-kicks-off-final-hours-singles-day-shopping-event-2021-11-10/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slim margin</a>, in part due to supply chain disruptions related to the pandemic.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

TOGETHER WITH NAADAM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Naadam" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/2241/1635272755-MB_Goat.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Might be a weird thing to say, but just look at that goat and tell us he isn’t a bodacious barnyard bleater. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can’t. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you <em>can</em> exude the same animal magnetism by scooping up some of the cozy clothes he’s modeling for <a href="https://naadam.co/collections/all?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Naadam</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://naadam.co/collections/all?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Naadam</a> makes the world’s fairest cashmere. They go straight to the source of the planet’s best cashmere—Mongolia’s Gobi Desert. They work with herders to get you <strong style="color:#000">high-quality, sustainable, and scrumptiously soft knitwear. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What that means is Naadam’s prices are fair—for them and for you. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The best part? For Singles Day, Naadam is offering <strong style="color:#000">30% off sitewide</strong> (some exclusions apply) with code <strong style="color:#000">FORYOU.</strong> So you can get something soft for <em>you</em> (though if you want to get some holiday gifts for a partner or a pal, we won’t tell). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://naadam.co/collections/all?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Naadam is ready to ship in 48 hours or less—get shopping here</a>. </p>
</td>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/key-performance-indicators-november-11?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>What have y’all been getting up to while working from home? Sales of pregnancy tests have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/09/baby-boom-ahead-bank-of-america-says-thats-good-news-for-these-stocks.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a> by an annual average of 13% since June 2020, Bank of America wrote, which may indicate a “millennial baby boom.” It’s a bullish sign for retailers like Target, Walmart, and Costco, BofA said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We consider Portugal one of the best places in the world for these digital nomads and remote workers to choose to live in.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Portugal has <a href="https://www.euronews.com/next/2021/11/08/portugal-makes-it-illegal-for-your-boss-to-text-you-after-work?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made it illegal</a> for your boss to send you a text after work hours. Ana Mendes Godinho, Portugal’s Minister of Labor and Social Security, said that the law is intended to improve work-life balance and attract more fully remote workers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A scientist on the myth of ugly produce and food waste. (<a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2019/2/26/18240399/food-waste-ugly-produce-myths-farms?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/tuvalu-exploring-ways-to-retain-status-as-a-country-as-sea-levels-rise?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tuvalu Not Interested in Being the Next Atlantis
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/10/tuvalu-exploring-ways-to-retain-status-as-a-country-as-sea-levels-rise?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tuvalu's foreign minister gives an address standing in water " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f2152766b277a581c2ec28965391a2f9178194f0-780x438.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tuvalu Ministry of Justice </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a riddle: If a country becomes completely submerged by water...is it still a country?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tuvalu wants to know. The tiny nation of 12,000 people in the Pacific Ocean is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/cop/tuvalu-looking-legal-ways-be-state-if-it-is-submerged-2021-11-09/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exploring ways</a> to retain its legal status as a country, as rising sea levels encroach on its land mass. On average, the country sits just 6 feet, 6 inches above sea level.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tuvalu’s Foreign Minister Simone Kofe told Reuters, “We're looking at legal avenues where we can retain our ownership of our maritime zones, retain our recognition as a state under international law” if its population were forced to leave.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But international law requires a state to have a permanent population and a defined territory, as the WaPo </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/11/09/cop26-tuvalu-underwater/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">notes</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Kofe went viral earlier this week for addressing the COP26 climate summit while standing knee-deep in water. He meant to highlight the growing threat of climate change to low-lying island nations, which have pleaded with industrialized powers to cut emissions and limit warming.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Frankly speaking, there is no dignity to a slow and painful death,” the president of Palau, another Pacific island nation, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/cop26-island-nations-risk-climate-change-struggle-make-point-rcna4912?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. “You might as well bomb our islands instead of making us suffer.”—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Business news and crossword puzzles—that’s what Morning Brew does. <a href="https://deadline.com/2021/11/disney-stock-q4-earnings-streaming-theme-parks-1234871392/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out our latest Mini here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than Lady Gaga’s accent in <em>House of Gucci</em>. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Man </span><span><a href="https://www.9news.com.au/national/brazil-news-man-eaten-by-piranhas-after-jumping-into-lake-to-escape-bees/be2c4793-b194-450f-9958-75bbd49e26fe?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eaten</a></span><span> by piranhas after jumping into lake to escape bees</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe share of veterans is rapidly declining, dropping to 7% in 2018 from 18% in 1980.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut, the share of veterans who are women is expected to increase, from 11% currently to 18% in style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInflation said it just needed a place to crash while it got back on its feet, but now it's officially moved in.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsumer prices rocketed higher than expected last month, jumping 6.2% annually for their biggest increase in 31 years, the Labor Department reported yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEverything from your gas bill to your breakfast is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/10/consumer-price-index-october.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting more expensive\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFuel oil prices climbed 12.3% last month and are now up 59.1% compared to last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMeat, poultry, fish, and eggs increased 1.7% last month and have climbed 11.9% for the year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere is good news for anyone planning a Miami vacation: Prices for alcohol and airline tickets fell.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow did we get here? \u003c/strong\u003eTo make a long story short, the economic reopening from the pandemic caused all sorts of disruptions, from labor shortages to supply chain bottlenecks, which have contributed to rising prices.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is now becoming a political issue\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith inflation coming in above 5% for five straight months now, many Americans are getting a little freaked out, and they are looking to policymakers for answers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOfficials are also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-inflation-cpi-rates-11636552015?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efrustrated\u003c/a\u003e—inflation was supposed to be a summer fling, not a serious relationship. “I had expected to see more progress by now,” Chicago Fed President Charles Evans acknowledged this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fed now believes that inflation will run hot well into next year, which has bolstered its plan to hike rates and cool down the economy. It’s already planning to reduce its monthly bond purchases that propped up markets during the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eTreasury Secretary Janet Yellen \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-09/yellen-says-fed-wouldn-t-allow-repeat-of-1970s-level-inflation?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estressed\u003c/a\u003e on Tuesday that officials won’t let inflation get as out of control as it did during periods of the ’70s and ’80s. “That isn’t happening now and the Federal Reserve wouldn’t permit that to happen,” she said. But it’s being put to the test.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-lifestyle-business-national-labor-relations-board-health-6f9a1f9a53fc874ebdb6438df1f4223f?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’d be historic. \u003c/strong\u003eThe coffee chain has dodged previous unionization efforts by offering pay increases and venti-sized benefit packages. But Buffalo-area employees say they deserve a bigger piece of the chain’s record-breaking revenue ($29 billion last fiscal year), especially after the pandemic put a spotlight on the safety risks of their jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarbucks \u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003edoesn’t want a second Bills Mafia. The company has urged employees to vote “no” on unionization and has sent what seems like \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/starbucks-executive-swept-floors-in-unionizing-buffalo-new-york-store-2021-9?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevery top exec \u003c/a\u003eon an upstate New York vacay.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt even pulled some out of retirement. Howard Schultz, the former CEO, flew to Buffalo on Saturday to give a 45-minute speech about Sbux’s incredible company culture.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWhether or not your PSL is part of labor activism history, the outcome of this union vote could reverberate across the rest of the restaurant industry, where recently empowered workers are fed up with style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore Amazon Prime Day, there was Alibaba’s Singles Day—a mega Chinese shopping event that starts on Nov. 1 and culminates with a grand finale today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast year, Singles Day generated nearly \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2021/11/01/what-we-know-about-11-11-china-s-sales-bonanza-so-far?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethree times\u003c/a\u003e as much in sales for Alibaba as Cyber Monday, Thanksgiving, and Black Friday \u003cem\u003ecombined\u003c/em\u003e did across the US. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut China’s biggest shopping holiday has been decidedly less hyped this year. The Chinese government has been \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/chinas-singles-day-shopping-fest-060050281.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebearing down\u003c/a\u003e on tech giants and pushing companies toward achieving “common prosperity,” which Alibaba added to its “core corporate responsibilities” list in September.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eEarlier in the year, Alibaba was fined a record $2.8 billion for antitrust violations, and cofounder Jack Ma has largely stayed out of the public eye for about a year (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z5VMX1CznCg\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot his style\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince the government’s new groove doesn’t jibe with Alibaba raking in billions on luxury goods, this year the company’s been playing down Singles Day marketing and instead playing up its sustainable growth initiatives and support for small businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eanalysts expect this Singles Day to top last year’s sales, possibly because a record number of merchants are participating. But it’ll only set a record by a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/chinas-alibaba-kicks-off-final-hours-singles-day-shopping-event-2021-11-10/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslim margin\u003c/a\u003e, in part due to supply chain disruptions related to the pandemic.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTuvalu Ministry of Justice \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s a riddle: If a country becomes completely submerged by water...is it still a country?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTuvalu wants to know. The tiny nation of 12,000 people in the Pacific Ocean is \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/cop/tuvalu-looking-legal-ways-be-state-if-it-is-submerged-2021-11-09/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexploring ways\u003c/a\u003e to retain its legal status as a country, as rising sea levels encroach on its land mass. On average, the country sits just 6 feet, 6 inches above sea level.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTuvalu’s Foreign Minister Simone Kofe told Reuters, “We're looking at legal avenues where we can retain our ownership of our maritime zones, retain our recognition as a state under international law” if its population were forced to leave.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut international law requires a state to have a permanent population and a defined territory, as the WaPo \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/11/09/cop26-tuvalu-underwater/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enotes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eKofe went viral earlier this week for addressing the COP26 climate summit while standing knee-deep in water. He meant to highlight the growing threat of climate change to low-lying island nations, which have pleaded with industrialized powers to cut emissions and limit warming.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Frankly speaking, there is no dignity to a slow and painful death,” the president of Palau, another Pacific island nation, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/cop26-island-nations-risk-climate-change-struggle-make-point-rcna4912?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. “You might as well bomb our islands instead of making us suffer.”—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
